page.title: 11ATHERTON MARKET
page.content: {ATHERTON MARKET}TAKES PLACE EVERY FRIDAY OF THE YEAR EXCEPT OF COURSE ON PUBLIC HOLIDAYS. IT IS SITUATED {BEHIND THE CHURCH}ON SOME COBBLED PAVEMENT. IT IS IN THE TRIANGULAR ROAD WHICH INCLUDES BOLTON ROAD, ST JOHN STREET AND MARKET STREET. THERE ARE ROUGHLY{40 OR SO STALLS}IN ALL. THERE ARE USUALLY FOUR ROWS OF TEN. THE STALLS ARE MADE OF WOOD AND THE GOODS ARE USUALLY ON THE STALL OR HANGING ON THE CANOPY WHICH SHELTERS THE MAIN PART OF THE STALL. THERE IS QUITE A LOT OF{PARKING SPACE}ON THE ACTUAL MARKET PLACE AND THERE IS A LARGE CAR PARK NEARBY.
